what: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: package provides bridge Bioconductor vast, homogeneously-processed transcriptomic data refine.bio. Cite refine.bio project : Casey S. Greene, Dongbo Hu, Richard W. W. Jones, Stephanie Liu, David S. Mejia, Rob Patro, Stephen R. Piccolo, Ariel Rodriguez Romero, Hirak Sarkar, Candace L. Savonen, Jaclyn N. Taroni, William E. Vauclain, Deepashree Venkatesh Prasad, Kurt G. Wheeler. refine.bio: resource uniformly processed publicly available gene expression datasets. URL: https://www.refine.bio

title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: project undergoing active development meant general use.

title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: RefineBio large number experiments available. can get list : Refine.bio uses multiples sources data. simple breakdown can obtained :
code: library(RefineBio) experiments <- experiment_listing() head(experiments) ## # A tibble: 6 × 21 ##      id title            publication_title description technology accession_code ##   <int> <chr>            <chr>             <chr>       <chr>      <chr>          ## 1 52090 Shared and dist… Shared and disti… Neocortex … RNA-SEQ    SRP150473      ## 2 51049 Transcriptome a… Conserved proper… RNA sequen… RNA-SEQ    SRP118985      ## 3 47744 In vivo molecul… Broadly neutrali… Dengue vir… RNA-SEQ    SRP152576      ## 4 67685 Drug-induced ch… The NCI Transcri… To identif… MICROARRAY GSE116436      ## 5 50699 Single-cell tra… Classes and cont… We  studie… RNA-SEQ    SRP109000      ## 6 51542 Single cell RNA… Diversity of Int… In order t… RNA-SEQ    SRP124669      ## # ℹ 15 more variables: alternate_accession_code <chr>, ## #   submitter_institution <chr>, has_publication <lgl>, publication_doi <chr>, ## #   publication_authors <list>, sample_metadata_fields <list>, ## #   platform_names <list>, platform_accession_codes <list>, ## #   organism_names <list>, downloadable_organism_names <list>, pubmed_id <chr>, ## #   num_total_samples <int>, num_processed_samples <int>, ## #   num_downloadable_samples <int>, source_first_published <date> dim(experiments) ## [1] 62518    21 sort(   table(gsub("[0-9]", "", experiments$accession_code)),   decreasing = TRUE ) ##  ##     GSE     SRP     ERP E-MTAB- E-MEXP-     DRP E-TABM- E-NASC- E-ATMX- E-TOXM-  ##   34239   24013    1743     894     858     412     203      59      23      20  ## E-CBIL- E-AFMX- E-MIMR- E-BAIR- E-HGMP- E-MAXD- E-BIID- E-EMBL- E-LGCL-  ##      19      10       9       8       3       2       1       1       1

title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: “experiment” refine.bio collection samples processed together. “dataset” collection experiments want analyze together. can create dataset : create dataset object can use download analyze data. “request” just . download process data. get actual data loaded R, need following: resulting list SummarizedExperiment objects :
code: dset <- rb_dataset_request("GSE1133") rb_dataset_ensure_started(dset) rb_wait_for_dataset(dset) rb_dataset_download(dset) rb_dataset_extract(dset) gselist <- rb_dataset_load(dset) gselist $GSE1133 class: SummarizedExperiment  dim: 11868 158  metadata(13): accession_code description ... technology title assays(1): exprs rownames: NULL rowData names(1): Gene colnames(158): GSM18865 GSM18866 ... GSM19021 GSM19022 colData names(57): refinebio_accession_code experiment_accession ... title type

title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: Add tests Run devtools::test() Run devtools::check() Run devtools::document() Run devtools::build() Update READMERmd Run devtools::build_readme() Update NEWS.md Update DESCRIPTION

title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: use roxygen2 documentation, including R6 classes use testthat testing use tidyverse style NEWS.md file

what: Complete list of all experiments in refine.bio — experiment_listing
title: Complete list of all experiments in refine.bio — experiment_listing
text: Refine.bio experiments collections samples processed together. practices, refine.bio experiments usually GEO series SRA study. function returns list experiments refine.bio tibble.

title: Complete list of all experiments in refine.bio — experiment_listing
Complete list of all experiments in refine.bio — experiment_listing
text: .pages integer(1) number pages retrieve (default=Inf). Generally, want ignore ; useful testing.

title: Complete list of all experiments in refine.bio — experiment_listing
text: tibble tibble experiments refine.bio. tibble contains following columns: id: ID experiment title: title experiment publication_title: title publication associated experiment description: description experiment accession_code: accession code experiment alternate_accession_code: alternate accession code experiment technology: technology used generate data experiment submitter_institution: institution submitted experiment has_publication: Whether experiment publication associated publication_doi: DOI publication associated experiment publication_authors: authors publication associated experiment pubmed_id: PubMed ID publication associated experiment source_first_published: date experiment first published num_total_samples: total number samples experiment num_processed_samples: number samples experiment processed num_downloadable_samples: number samples experiment downloadable platform_names: names platforms used experiment organism_names: names organisms experiment sample_metadata_fields: types metadata available samples experiment samples: data.frame sample metadata

title: Complete list of all experiments in refine.bio — experiment_listing
text: Sean Davis seandavi@gmail.com Alex Ho alexander.2.ho@cuanschutz.edu

title: Complete list of all experiments in refine.bio — experiment_listing
code: # this takes about 1-2 minutes to complete # for the entire experiment listing # depending on your internet connection # You only need to do this once (or when you want #   to update the results)  # get the first 2 pages of experiments for # testing and demonstration purposes experiments <- experiment_listing(.pages = 2)  # get all experiments # experiments <- experiment_listing()  head(experiments) #> # A tibble: 6 × 21 #>      id title            publication_title description technology accession_code #>   <int> <chr>            <chr>             <chr>       <chr>      <chr>          #> 1 52090 Shared and dist… Shared and disti… Neocortex … RNA-SEQ    SRP150473      #> 2 51049 Transcriptome a… Conserved proper… RNA sequen… RNA-SEQ    SRP118985      #> 3 47744 In vivo molecul… Broadly neutrali… Dengue vir… RNA-SEQ    SRP152576      #> 4 67685 Drug-induced ch… The NCI Transcri… To identif… MICROARRAY GSE116436      #> 5 50699 Single-cell tra… Classes and cont… We  studie… RNA-SEQ    SRP109000      #> 6 51542 Single cell RNA… Diversity of Int… In order t… RNA-SEQ    SRP124669      #> # ℹ 15 more variables: alternate_accession_code <chr>, #> #   submitter_institution <chr>, has_publication <lgl>, publication_doi <chr>, #> #   publication_authors <list>, sample_metadata_fields <list>, #> #   platform_names <list>, platform_accession_codes <list>, #> #   organism_names <list>, downloadable_organism_names <list>, pubmed_id <chr>, #> #   num_total_samples <int>, num_processed_samples <int>, #> #   num_downloadable_samples <int>, source_first_published <date> dim(experiments) #> [1] 2000   21 colnames(experiments) #>  [1] "id"                          "title"                       #>  [3] "publication_title"           "description"                 #>  [5] "technology"                  "accession_code"              #>  [7] "alternate_accession_code"    "submitter_institution"       #>  [9] "has_publication"             "publication_doi"             #> [11] "publication_authors"         "sample_metadata_fields"      #> [13] "platform_names"              "platform_accession_codes"    #> [15] "organism_names"              "downloadable_organism_names" #> [17] "pubmed_id"                   "num_total_samples"           #> [19] "num_processed_samples"       "num_downloadable_samples"    #> [21] "source_first_published"

title: load a list of SummarizedExperiments from an extracted RefineBio download — extract_local_dataset
load a list of SummarizedExperiments from an extracted RefineBio download — extract_local_dataset
code: # load the SummarizedExperiment package # We'll need it later. suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(SummarizedExperiment))  # use an example datastore datastore_path <- datastore_example_path()  # Get the first dataset from the datastore example_dataset <- datastore_datasets(datastore_path)[1]  # Get the path to the dataset example_dataset_path <- file.path(datastore_path, example_dataset)  # Load the dataset example_se_list <- extract_local_dataset(example_dataset_path) #> Error in extract_local_dataset(example_dataset_path): Could not find metadata file in download directory.  # Get the first experiment example_se <- example_se_list[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'example_se_list' not found  example_se #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'example_se' not found  # Get the first experiment's metadata str(metadata(example_se)) #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'metadata': object 'example_se' not found

what: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
title: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
text: function returns list available compendia refine.bio.

title: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
text: periodically release compendia comprised samples species able process. refer refine.bio compendia. offer two kinds refine.bio compendia:count Normalized compendia RNA-seq compendia types compendia available download RefineBio website. details compendia generated described RefineBio site documentation summarized convenience.

title: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
text: Refine.bio normalized compendia comprised samples species able process, aggregate, normalize. Normalized compendia provide snapshot complete collection gene expression refine.bio can produce supported organism. process compendia manner different options available via web user interface. Note submitter processed samples available web user interface omitted normalized compendia samples can introduce unwanted technical variation. refine.bio web interface inner join datasets combined, genes present datasets included final matrix. compendia, take union genes, filling missing values NA. “full outer join” illustrated RefineBio site documentation. use full outer join allows us retain genes compendium impute missing values compendia creation.

title: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
text: refine.bio RNA-seq sample compendia comprised Salmon output collection RNA-seq samples organism processed refine.bio. individual sample quant.sf file; samples aggregated normalized. RNA-seq sample compendia designed allow users comfortable handling files generate output useful downstream applications. Please see Salmon documentation quant.sf output format information.

what: Create or get an active API token for use in downloading from the API — rb_get_token
